item.title: HP Adds Another 80% Off Laptop as Holiday Clearance Deals Continue on Amazon, Not Listed on Official Site
item.content:encoded:
Laptops (and PCs) don‚Äôt have to be massive or insanely expensive to get the job done. If you‚Äôre after a machine that takes care of all your everyday work and play-related tasks with ease, Amazon is letting you upgrade for under $500 right now; you read that right.

The 15.6-inch HP laptop, which would run you around $2,000 on a regular day, is currently going for $400. That‚Äôs after the retailer took a whopping 80% off its retail tag. But as you‚Äôd expect, the deal is selling fast. Whether you‚Äôre looking to snap one for yourself or want to gift it to a student or work professional in your life this holiday season, now is a good time to make the move.

Immersive Display, Reliable Performance

Looks-wise, it‚Äôs a classic HP laptop. The sleek, lightweight design makes it ultra-portable, letting you carry it around easily wherever you go. The 15.6-inch screen is bright, while the 85% screen-to-body ratio offers a larger room to work and play on. You‚Äôll enjoy crisp, vibrant visuals consistently (for movies, shows, presentations), and also won‚Äôt have to fight your own reflections when working in well-lit rooms. Translation? An immersive viewing experience that‚Äôs easy on the eyes, even when using the laptop for an extended period of time. Paired with the screen is a full-sized, soft grey keyboard with a numeric keypad to make typing long documents comfortable.

HP has packed the laptop with a 4-core Intel N100 processor that‚Äôs capable of hitting speeds up to 3.4 GHz with Intel Turbo Boost Technology. It does not make the machine a powerhouse, sure, but it‚Äôs still great for regular office work, study requirements, and post-work entertainment. There‚Äôs a 16GB RAM to keep everything running smoothly, and especially comes in handy when you‚Äôre trying to multitask through busy days. With this at hand, you‚Äôll be able to use a bunch of different applications at the same time, keep a ton of tabs open on your browser, take some quick meetings, and more; without noticeable slowdowns that kill the momentum.

As for storage, it gets you a 256GB PCIe NVMe M.2 SSD, which can house your important work documents, some media files, and necessary programs. We won‚Äôt sugarcoat it; the storage isn‚Äôt massive, so if you‚Äôre someone with a massive library of heavier projects, it might not be sufficient for you. But for casual use, it does the job. Moreover, SSDs are much faster than traditional drives, so you‚Äôll also enjoy fast boot and load times with this one.

Connectivity options include Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.3 wireless card, and a wide range of ports, including one USB Type-C, two USB Type-A, one HDMI, one headphone/microphone combo, and an AC smart pin. Some other features that deserve a mention are dual speakers and an HP True Vision 720p HD camera to make video calls a breeze.

There‚Äôs a lot more to like about this laptop, especially at its current price. You can grab it for just $400 right now, which is nothing considering all the features it packs. item.title: Clair Obscur Gets Free DLC Including A Photo Mode To Celebrate Historic Awards Sweep
item.content:encoded:
Everyone knew Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 was a frontrunner to clinch some of the biggest categories at The Game Awards 2025, but I don‚Äôt know that anyone expected it to sweep the night and set a new record for winning nine awards (The Last Of Us 2 earned seven back in 2020). Instead of resting on its laurels, Sandfall Interactive used the night to shadow-drop Clair Obscur‚Äòs free mini-DLC to give fans a reason to dive back into the Belle √âpoque RPG.

This content drop was teased earlier this year and includes a new playable environment called ‚ÄúVerso‚Äôs Drafts‚Äù inspired by the character‚Äôs childhood. There‚Äôs also new late-game boss battles, more Luminas and Weapons, extra costumes, and the addition of a photo mode for players to document their dress-up sessions with. Here‚Äôs a trailer for the new area:

The photo mode comes with dozens of filters and the devs say they‚Äôre excited to see how players use them to capture moments from the game‚Äôs memorable cinematic scenes in completely new ways. And for anyone who hasn‚Äôt played Clair Obscure yet, it‚Äôs worth noting that the game is currently just $40. Normally $50, it‚Äôs 20 percent off on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox until December 16. It‚Äôs also still available on Game Pass.

Here are the full patch notes for the free 1.5 update:

  • Verso‚Äôs Drafts, a new playable environment, taking the characters of Expedition 33 to a brand-new location with new enemy encounters and surprises to discover üôÇ

    • Located on the World Map, next to Lumi√®re ‚Äì Accessible from Act III

    • Esquie‚Äôs Underwater ability is required!

  • New text and UI game localizations into Czech, Ukrainian, Latin American Spanish, Turkish, Vietnamese, Thai, and Indonesian, bringing the total number of supported languages to 19, with more to come!

  • New costumes for each member of the Expedition, giving even more customization options for players throughout their adventure 

  • New boss battles for late-game players to overcome in the Endless Tower ‚Äì They are variations of iconic bosses from the main game, designed to be even more challenging

  • Added new Luminas and Weapons

  • Added the ‚ÄúOld Key‚Äù quest item to the final area of the game ‚Äì Previously obtainable only during the Prologue, this addition gives players a second chance to collect all journals within a single playthrough

  • Added Photo Mode with plenty of settings and options for players to get creative with while capturing your favourite moments from the game, accessible at any time from the pause menu! 

  • Added Lumina Sets feature, allowing players to save up to 50 different lumina loadouts for adapting to plenty of different fighting tactics at any moment 

  • Added Abandon Battle option in the pause menu which can now be opened in battle 

  • Added HUD Scale setting, allowing players to adjust the size of in-game HUD elements from 80% to 120% 

  • Added FSR 4 support, including AMD temporal upscaling for sharper visuals and Frame Generation for smoother gameplay on compatible GPUs 

  • Added new filters for Pictos and Luminas and improved the UI 

  • Added input remapping for controller

  • The game is now certified on Steam Deck and ROG Xbox Ally! 

  • Global improvement of text legibility

  • Fixed multiple fog and lighting issues:  

    • Overly intense effects during the Flying Manor boss fight (which also impacted some cinematics) 

    • Overexposed areas in the Visages 

    • Overly dark areas in the Endless Tower

  • Fixed FPS being capped at 30 on Steam Deck 

  • VSync can now be properly disabled in the settings when playing on Steam Deck

  • Graphic settings are now adjusted for Steam Deck users 

  • Improved first-time setup flow:  

    • Controller input is now supported in installation wizards (no longer touchscreen-only)

  • External controllers now switch seamlessly with the Steam Deck controls 

  • Fixed an issue where using Battle Retry after a cinematic or automatic trigger could spawn the player out of the world if the last save was created in a different location 

  • The playtime displayed on save files now accurately reflects total playtime, including time spent on Game Overs
    (Note: this fix does not retroactively update existing save files.) 

  • Fixed inventory behaviour so that sort order now persists after closing the game menu 

  • Fixed issue preventing Intel XeSS Frame Generation setting from being accessible on PC Game Pass 

  • Fixed an issue where the usage of particular diacritic marks (e.g. ^, ~, ¬¥, `) in Windows is blocked after launching the title

  • Fixed Breaking Death always breaking all enemies when the character dies, it should only break the enemy that killed the character ‚Äì As a result, it shouldn‚Äôt work when the character kills themself anymore

  • Characters‚Äô turn order during a First Strike, triggered by attacking an enemy on the map, now correctly respects characters‚Äô Speed

  • Fixed Boucharo giving +150% Critical chance instead of +50% Critical chance 

  • Fixed some Luminas giving unintended hidden +10% damage:  

    • Sweet Kill  

    • Teamwork 

    • Dead Energy II 

    • First Strike and others

item.title: Logitech‚Äôs Wireless Gaming Headset Deal Comes Early, Hitting Its Cheapest Price Yet Despite Being Newly Released
item.content:encoded:
Enhance your gaming experience by treating yourself to audio that actually does your games justice. If you‚Äôve been relying on the default speakers built into your TV, you probably don‚Äôt realize how much you‚Äôre missing. Switching to a quality over-ear headset feels a lot like discovering you‚Äôve needed glasses your entire life‚Äîonce you try it, everything suddenly becomes sharper and far more detailed. With proper surround sound, you can pick up tiny environmental cues, like the faint scuffle of an opponent approaching from behind, and identify their position using audio alone. Even better, the Logitech G522 Lightspeed PC gaming headset is currently 25% off, dropping from $160 to just $120 for a limited time.

See at Amazon

Advanced Synchronized Audio

Logitech knows to take comms seriously. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you are a pro-level League player telling your jungler when to make their move or if you‚Äôre just laughing with friends because you barreled back down the mountain in PEAK again. The best in class voice clarity with full bandwidth 48 khz/16 bit microphone ensures your words are coming across crystal-clear. Its can handle broadcast-quality audio if you intend to use this headset while livestreaming on Twitch.

The audio you hear is equally impressive. The state-of-the-art PRO-G audio drivers can deliver synchronized 48 khz/24 bit audio of the highest quality, producing rich bass with minimal distortion. You get real sound‚Äînot the hollow tin-can crap you hear with bargain-bin headsets.

The Logitech G522 Lightspeed headset offers several choices for how to connect to your PC or mobile devices. Use a wired USB-A and USB-C connection for uninterrupted play. Bluetooth is also supported so you can connect to your phone or even a Nintendo Switch 2.

Any gaming headset worth its weight in gold needs to be comfortable. The Logitech G522 Lightspeed headset utilizes rounded cushion ear cups for maximum comfort. The suspension band allows it to fit around the contour of your head perfectly. Plus, its washable so you can keep the whole thing hygienic. No one has ever gotten a Victory Royale without sweating a little bit. The headset is lightweight too so you‚Äôll barely even notice it while wearing it on your dome.

And of course, this wouldn‚Äôt be a capital-G ‚ÄúGamer‚Äù accessory without the state-of-play-mandated RGB support. The side-facing lighting can produce up to 16.8 million colors, fully customizable by you. There are eight different lighting zones across the headset so you can create different combinations of colors.

Battery life is another standout. With lighting off, you‚Äôll be hitting close to the 60 hours of game time before you need to plug it back in. Not stats unfortunately on how long the headset lasts with lighting on. And with a 30-meter wireless range, you can wander off between matches to make much-needed trips to the kitchen to replenish your snacks without losing audio.

item.title: The Street Fighter Movie Is Going To Be Way Weirder Than You Think
item.content:encoded:
Last night‚Äôs Game Awards revealed the first trailer for next year‚Äôs Street Fighter movie, and people‚Äôs reaction has been excellent to watch. Given the source material, and the multiple straight-faced attempts to make it work as a movie over the last few decades, there was a base assumption that this would be another self-serious attempt to make a dramatic action movie. When it was clearly not that, something that looked both fun and even funny, the world reacted with a collective ‚Äúhuh?‚Äù But to solve the puzzle, there‚Äôs one important piece that people missed: the director.

Street Fighter is being directed by Kitao Sakurai. Who‚Äôs that, you ask. Kitao Sakurai is the director of 62 episodes of The Eric Andre Show.

If that doesn‚Äôt mean anything to you, this should help:

And now we‚Äôre all on the same page.

I think it‚Äôs really worth watching the Street Fighter movie trailer again, following the above.

I was pretty sure that was Eric Andre dancing behind the news desk as Don Sauvage for a split-second there the first time I watched. And yup, it is! And it all starts to make so much more sense.

As social media filled with memes about the extraordinary new look for Guile, and game sites tried to comprehend what they‚Äôd just seen, it was all reasonably skewed by prior expectations. Me too! And Kotaku in general! Ethan‚Äôs take was to call the trailer ‚Äúsurprisingly good.‚Äù It‚Äôs only 16 years since we were served Andrzej Bartkowiak Street Fighter: The Legend of Chun-Li (a 17 on Metacritic), and no one can shake 1994‚Äôs Steven E. de Souza version, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme and Kylie Minogue. There was no reason to think that that we should hope for something better this time, either. So watching the trailer, preconceptions were so heavy that it was almost impossible to see what was really happening.

What we actually see in this trailer is deranged. With the blinkers of pessimism removed, every cliched pose, every choreographed punch and kick, starts to reveal what it truly is: a goof. Seriously, look closer. That hoary old shot of Zangief pulling the tractor‚Äîthere are two bored men sat on top of it, one reading a paper. The crash zoom on Andrew Koji‚Äôs Ryu, a shameless Bruce Lee rip-off moment‚Äîthat‚Äôs on purpose. And Noah Centineo looking like the Ken doll version of Ken Masters‚Äîthat also makes much more sense. In this light, Guile‚Äôs spectacular (and faithful!) flattop is no longer an anomaly, but a natural part of events.

Now factor in the details like how Kyle Mooney has a character in this film, and how Sakurai‚Äôs more recent work has included Twisted Metal, and his only previous feature film was the surprisingly good genre-bending comedy Bad Trip starring Eric Andre and Lil Rey Howery, and there‚Äôs no way to believe this new Street Fighter movie is going to be a weird-ass comedy from start to finish.

Heck, given the pacing on the Eric Andre Show, the frenetic trailer might even match the final experience.
